Hack Arizona Live


Submit Your Hack!

Welcome to the largest collegiate Hackathon in the Southwest. We are so excited to have you here, and even more excited to see what you do.

Hack Arizona Live will serve as a central point for all of your information needs throughout the weekend. Find things like meal times, competitive categories, and travel information.

Please check back frequently, as we will be continuing to add details throughout the week.

Judging

Hey Hackers!

Are you ready to win some prizes for all your hard work? Will your demonstration knock their socks off?

9:00am - Hacking Ends
9:30am - Judging Begins
12:00pm - Finalist Demo Presentations

Important Information

Doors open for Demo setup in the South Room 2nd Floor at 9:00AM, so grab a table and set up your projects.

A lot like at a science fair, judges will walk from table to table while participants show off what they have hacked. Make sure you have a working demo and a quick pitch to give the judges.

Projects must be submitted by 9:00AM.

Are you participating in the Best Drone Hack?

Here is your schedule for the day!
8:00am - Raytheon teams set up
8:30am - Drone judging starts
9:00am - Breakfast is served
10:30am - Raytheon will announce winner of best drone challenge
10:40am - Film winning team for closing ceremony
11:45am - Head over to Modern Language 350 for the closing ceremony

On Campus

We have two buildings and a few outdoor locations we'll be using for Hack Arizona.

Science and Engineering Library - Main
Modern Languages - Ceremonies
Chemical Sciences Patio - Food!
Bear Down Field - Drone Testing

Check out the Campus Map on the next tab for the visual!

Parking

Check out Parking Info Here!

Navigating Campus

Click the map for an interactive map of the University of Arizona.

Flying In

We highly recommend that out-of-state attendees reserve their plane tickets as soon as possible to minimize cost. If possible, you should fly into Tucson International Airport, as opposed to Phoenix Sky Harbor.

Tucson International -> University of Arizona - Take Bus #25 from the airport to the Ronstadt Transit Center then transfer to either the Modern Street Car, or Bus #6 to the University Boulevard stop.
Routes and Times Here.

Phoenix Sky Harbor -> University of Arizona - See the options listed under in-state travel.

Driving In

There are a number of shuttle services from most major cities in Arizona that will take you straight to the University of Arizona campus. Links to the most reliable of these services are listed below.

Option 1 - http://arizonashuttle.com/ - This service will cost roughly 40 dollars one-way, however it is clean and offers a broad range of travel times. When choosing your drop-off point, select University.

Option 2 - https://www.greyhound.com/Express/Default.aspx - A more economic option, the Greyhound bus offers shuttle services from most cities in Arizona to downtown Tucson. The Greyhound will drop you off at the centrally-located Ronstadt Center. From the Ronstadt center, take the Suntran Streetcar to the University. The cost for a one-day Suntran pass is ~ $4.00.

How It Works

How To Check In

Check-in begins at 4pm. Queue up inside the main entrance of the Science and Engineering Library for check-in. You'll sign our wavier and get a wristband & a swag bag.

Not Registered?: If you are a University of Arizona student, and you would like to "walk-on" Friday, be prepared to register and receive a walk-on wristband.

Have A Question?

Our Desert Guides will be available to assist you with your event questions and issues during the event. Find them in Green t-shirts around the venue.

Sponsor Prizes

Company Summary Prize The Deets
Raytheon Best Drone Hack(s) (Up to 2 Teams!) Parrot Ar.Drone 2.0 Elite for each team member Winning hacks will be judged based upon their innovation, creativity, technical complexity, and polish.
Wolfram Best or Most Innovative Use of Wolfram Technologies $500 in Visa Gift Cards Use of Wolfram Programming Cloud, Wolfram Language, Mathematica, and/or Wolfram|Alpha API.
Twilio Best Twilio integration An Arduino Yun for each team member
Amazon Most imaginative use Amazon tech An Amazon Fire TV Stick for each team member The most imaginative application of an Amazon technology
Respoke Coolest app using the Respoke API A Sphero App-Controlled Ball for each team member Push the boundaries of interactivity by adding real-time communications to your web app! Build a next-generation customer service workflow, use the Respoke data channel to reduce lag in your real-time games, add audio/video calling as a feature of your application... The possibilities are endless, and we are excited to see what you come up with! Find out how to get started at: http://respoke.github.io/angelhack/
USAA Most Collaborative Team $150 Visa gift card per student Reflected by each team member's contribution to the final end-product. Physical contributions, Process contributions, Leveraging inexperienced and experienced students alike
Nest Best use of the Nest API One of these: A Nest Thermostat, Protect, OR Dropcam Pro for each participant
UFree Best Hack around the social networking category UFree Promo Items
Sunquest Best Hack in the Health category $100 per student
